qas.question: In what country is soft adult contemporary called "EZ Rock"?
Along with MOR, easy listening and soft rock, what format is soft adult contemporary a successor to?
What occupation is stereotypical held by soft adult contemporary listeners?
What advertising demographic is soft adult contemporary marketed towards?
What station first introduced the tagline "everyone at work can agree on"?

context: Other popular names for the format include "Warm", "Sunny", "Bee" (or "B") and (particularly in <a0_0>Canada<a0_0/>) "EZ Rock". The format can be seen as a more contemporary successor to and combination of the middle of the road (MOR), <a1_0>beautiful music<a1_0/>, easy listening and soft rock formats. Many stations in the soft AC format capitalize on its appeal to <a2_0>office workers<a2_0/> (many of them <a3_0>females aged 25–54<a3_0/>, a key advertiser demographic), and brand themselves as stations "everyone at work can agree on" (<a4_0>KOST<a4_0/> originated that phrase as a primary tagline, and other soft AC stations have followed suit).
